title: Strictly week 4 leaderboard as Karim soars to the top with high score while Alex trails
text:
Get the biggest Strictly Come Dancing stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Last week the Strictly Come Dancing cast waved goodbye to yet another celebrity as Anneka Rice followed in the footsteps of Olympic Rower James Cracknell and shimmered off the dance floor for the final time.

According to Coral, former England footballer David James is the celebrity expected to be voted off the hit BBC dance show this week.

However, tonight's glittering show was a big one as competition heated up for the remaining 13 couples.

Karim Zeroual and Amy Dowden soared to the top of the leaderboard after their week four passionate Tango performance tonight.

Two points behind were Kelvin Fletcher and Oti Mabuse, who scored 36 for their saucy Rumba performance.

At the other end of the table are Alex Scott and Neil Jones, who finished last on the leaderboard with 23.

Last week's explosive movie theme saw Hollywood glitz and glamour take over the studio and couple Kelvin Fletcher and his pro dance partner Oti Mabuse were awarded the the first 10 of the current series.

Here's a look at tonight's leaderboard and individual scores for the dances...

Chris Ramsay and Karen Hauer

Chris and Karen danced the jive to Saturday Night’s Alright (For Fighting) by Elton John.

Here are the judges' scores:

Shirley - 7

Motsi - 7

Craig - 6

Bruno - 6

Total: 26

(Image: BBC)

Emma Barton and Anton Du Beke

Emma and Anton danced the Vienesse Waltz to Send in the Clowns by Barbara Streisand.

Here are the judges' scores:

Shirley - 9

Motsi - 9

Craig - 8

Bruno - 9

Total: 35

(Image: BBC)

Dev Patel and Dianne Buswell

Dev and Dianne danced the Cha Cha to Dancing With a Stranger by Sam Smith featuring Normani.

Here are the judges' scores:

Shirley - 7

Motsi - 7

Craig - 6

Bruno - 7

Total: 27

Catherine Tyldesley and Johannes Radebe

Catherine and Johannes danced the Charleston to Single Ladies by Beyoncé.

Here are the judges' scores:

Shirley - 8

Motsi - 8

Craig - 6

Bruno - 8

Total: 30

(Image: BBC)

Alex Scott and Neil Jones

Alex and Neil danced the Tango to Go Your Own Way by Fleetwood Mac.

Here are the judges' scores:

Shirley - 6

Motsi - 6

Craig - 4

Bruno - 7

Total: 23

(Image: BBC)

David James and Nadiya Bychkova

David and Nadiya danced the Quickstep to From Now On from The Greatest Showman by Hugh Jackman.

Here are the judges' scores:

Shirley - 7

Motsi - 7

Craig - 6

Bruno - 8

Total: 28

Kelvin Fletcher and Oti Mabuse

Kelvin and Oti danced the Rumba to Ain’t No Sunshine by Bill Withers.

Here are the judges' scores:

Shirley - 9

Motsi - 9

Craig - 9

Bruno - 9

Total: 36

(Image: BBC)

Viscountess Emma Weymouth and Aljaž Škorjanec

Viscountess Emma and Aljaž danced the Jive to Kids in America by Kim Wilde.

Here are the judges' scores:

Shirley - 7

Motsi - 7

Craig - 7

Bruno - 7

Total: 28

Michelle Visage and Giovanni Pernice

Michelle and Giovanni danced the Salsa to Quimbara by Johnny Pacheco and Celia Cruz.

Here are the judges' scores:

Shirley - 8

Motsi - 8

Craig - 7

Bruno - 8

Total: 31

(Image: BBC)

Will Bayley and Janette Manrara

Will and Janette danced the Foxtrot to Señorita by Shawn Mendes and Camila Cabello.

Here are the judges' scores:

Shirley - 6

Motsi - 6

Craig - 6

Bruno - 6

Total: 24

(Image: BBC/Guy Levy)

Mike Bushell and Katya Jones

Mike and Katya danced the Quickstep to Come on Eileen by Dexys Midnight Runners.

Here are the judges' scores:

Shirley - 8

Motsi - 9

Craig - 7

Bruno - 8

Total: 32

(Image: BBC)

Saffron Barker and AJ Pritchard

Saffron and AJ danced Contemporary for their Couple’s Choice routine to Because You Loved Me by Celine Dion.

Here are the judges' scores:

Shirley - 9

Motsi - 8

Craig - 7

Bruno - 9

Total: 33

Karim Zeroual and Amy Dowden

Karim and Amy danced the Tango to Paradise by George Ezra.

Here are the judges' scores:

Shirley - 9

Motsi - 10

Craig - 9

Bruno - 10

Total: 38

The top scorers of last week were Kelvin Fletcher and Oti Mabuse. The couple scored the first 10s of the series which put them in first place. Tonight, Karim beat Kelvin to the top spot and was also given two 10s.

Anneka Rice and Kevin Clifton received the lowest score last week. They were awarded a total of 11 points for their Charleston to Woo Hoo from Kill Bill. This week's lowest scoring couple Alex Scott and Neil Jones still scored a lot higher than Anneka with 23.

It's no surprise that Anneka and Kevin waved goodbye to the other couples last week with their low score as they were booted off the show. Tomorrow's results show will see another celebrity booted off the show and join Anneka and James Cracknell.

*Strictly results air tomorrow on BBC One
description: Competition heated up as the remaining 13 couples took to the dance floor to some popular tracks following explosive Movie Week
